metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: HTML Elements
An HTML element is defined by a start tag, some content, and an end tag.
content.html: An HTML element is defined by a start tag, some content, and an end tag.

content.text: HTML Elements
The HTML element is everything from the start tag to the end tag:
content.html: The HTML element is everything from the start tag to the end tag:

content.text: Examples of some HTML elements:
content.html: Examples of some HTML elements:

content.code_html:
Start tag Element content End tag
<h1> My First Heading </h1>
<p> My first paragraph. </p>
<br> none none

content.text:
Note: Some HTML elements have no content (like the
element). These elements are called empty elements. Empty elements do not have an end tag!
content.html: Note: Some HTML elements have no content (like the <br> element). These elements are called empty elements. Empty elements do not have an end tag!

content.text: Nested HTML Elements
HTML elements can be nested (this means that elements can contain other elements).
content.html: HTML elements can be nested (this means that elements can contain other elements).

content.text: All HTML documents consist of nested HTML elements.
content.html: All HTML documents consist of nested HTML elements.

content.text:
The following example contains four HTML elements ( , ,

and

):
content.html: The following example contains four HTML elements (<html>, <body>, <h1> and <p>):

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<h1>My First Heading</h1>
<p>My first paragraph.</p>

</body>
</html>

content.text: Example Explained
The <html> element is the root element and it defines the whole HTML document.
content.html: The <html> element is the root element and it defines the whole HTML document.

content.text: It has a start tag <html> and an end tag </html> .
content.html: It has a start tag <html> and an end tag </html>.

content.text: Then, inside the <html> element there is a <body> element:
content.html: Then, inside the <html> element there is a <body> element:

content.code_html:
<body>

<h1>My First Heading</h1>
<p>My first paragraph.</p>

</body>

content.text: The <body> element defines the document's body.
content.html: The <body> element defines the document's body.

content.text: It has a start tag <body> and an end tag </body> .
content.html: It has a start tag <body> and an end tag </body>.

content.text:
Then, inside the element there are two other elements:

and

:
content.html: Then, inside the <body> element there are two other elements: <h1> and <p>:

content.code_html:
<h1>My First Heading</h1>
<p>My first paragraph.</p>

content.text: The <h1> element defines a heading.
content.html: The <h1> element defines a heading.

content.text:
It has a start tag

and an end tag

:
content.html: It has a start tag <h1> and an end tag </h1>:

content.code_html: <h1>My First Heading</h1>

content.text:
The

element defines a paragraph.
content.html: The <p> element defines a paragraph.

content.text:
It has a start tag

and an end tag

:
content.html: It has a start tag <p> and an end tag </p>:

content.code_html: <p>My first paragraph.</p>

content.text: Never Skip the End Tag
Some HTML elements will display correctly, even if you forget the end tag:
content.html: Some HTML elements will display correctly, even if you forget the end tag:

content.code:
This is a paragraph

This is a paragraph
content.code_html:
<html>
<body>

<p>This is a paragraph
<p>This is a paragraph

</body>
</html>

content.text: However, never rely on this! Unexpected results and errors may occur if you forget the end tag!
content.html: However, never rely on this! Unexpected results and errors may occur if you forget the end tag!

content.text: Empty HTML Elements
HTML elements with no content are called empty elements.
content.html: HTML elements with no content are called empty elements.

content.text:
The
tag defines a line break, and is an empty element without a closing tag:
content.html: The <br> tag defines a line break, and is an empty element without a closing tag:

content.code:
This is a
paragraph with a line break.
content.code_html: <p>This is a <br> paragraph with a line break.</p>

content.text: HTML is Not Case Sensitive

HTML tags are not case sensitive:

means the same as

.
content.html: HTML tags are not case sensitive: <P> means the same as <p>.

content.text: The HTML standard does not require lowercase tags, but W3C recommends lowercase in HTML, and demands lowercase for stricter document types like XHTML.
content.html: The HTML standard does not require lowercase tags, but W3C recommends lowercase in HTML, and demands lowercase for stricter document types like XHTML.

content.text: At W3Schools we always use lowercase tag names.
content.html: At W3Schools we always use lowercase tag names.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
True or False. Empty elements must have a close tag.
content.html: True or False. Empty elements must have a close tag.

metadata.question: True or False. Empty elements must have a close tag.

content.question: True or False. Empty elements must have a close tag.

content.text: HTML Tag Reference
W3Schools' tag reference contains additional information about these tags and their attributes.
content.html: W3Schools' tag reference contains additional information about these tags and their attributes.

content.code_html:
Tag Description
<html> Defines the root of an HTML document
<body> Defines the document's body
<h1> to <h6> Defines HTML headings

content.text: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference .
content.html: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.

content.text: Video: HTML Elements
